Title: Netanyahu says he asked media mogul to change news site's people ...
Description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is testifying in his criminal trial for a second day on Wednesday, eight years after investigations into him first began. He faces charges of bribery, fraud, and breach of trust in three separate corruption cases. Netanyahu's testimony follows years of investigations, deliberations, legal proceedings, and delays. He is the first sitting prime minister in Israeli history to take the witness stand as a defendant.

Title: An Israeli-Palestinian boy band arrives in L.A. on Oct. 6, 2023. ...
Description: Paramount+'s docuseries 'as1one' is at its most interesting when the six bandmates – four Israelis and two Palestinians – talk Israel-Palestine politics. If only the producers had the guts not to stymie the debate

Title: Omri and the rest of the hostages must return – for the children...
Description: Lishay Miran Lavi says her life is still a living nightmare since her husband Omri Miran was kidnapped on October 7. A long-awaited meeting with the prime minister did little to boost her morale. 'Omri was taken before our children's eyes,' she says, adding that they are still waiting for their father

Title: Netanyahu, in first courtroom testimony, says he only ever served...
Description: The Israeli prime minister admitted to having a person friendship with the owner of Walla, but claimed the news site's coverage of him was hostile and negligible. He said that he tried to diversify the telecom market, which he claimed was dominated by left-leaning outlets. The judges allowed Netanyahu to receive ostensibly urgent notes during his testimony – apparently a way of allowing him to interrupt the flow of his testimony

Title: In a Tel Aviv court, the many faces of Benjamin Netanyahu were on...

Title: Netanyahu's testimony depicted an upside-down Israel. It could co...
Description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's appearance in the Tel Aviv District Courthouse on Tuesday was a cold comfort in a country where the rule has already defeated the law. Title: First day of Netanyahu's testimony concludes as PM portrays himse...
Description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu testified in his criminal trial for the first time on Tuesday, eight years after the investigations into him were first opened. He faces charges of bribery, fraud, and breach of trust across three different corruption cases. Netanyahu's testimony follows years of investigations, deliberations, legal proceedings, and delays. He became the first sitting prime minister in Israeli history to take the witness stand as a defendant.

Title: After Yossi was killed my faith was shattered. I appear strong, ...
Description: Yossi Sharabi was abducted on October 7 and later killed in captivity. His wife, Nira, is now fighting to bring home his brother, Eli, who was also kidnapped, and her husband's body. 'I want Eli to be here for everyone who is still here to be comforted by him'

Title: Three Israeli soldiers killed in northern Gaza combat, IDF announ...
Description: ISRAEL: Israeli ministers call on court administration to postpone Netanyahu's trial testimony due to security situation; White House's Sullivan to visit Israel on Thursday to discuss Syria, Gaza hostage deal ■ SYRIA: Foreign Minister Sa'ar says Israel attacked 'strategic weapons' in Syria to keep them out of hands of extremist factions ■ GAZA: Hamas sends Egypt list of hostages destined for release, including four American citizens, according to report

Title: IDF: Drone from Yemen struck apartment building in central Israel...
Description: ISRAEL: IDF intercepts missile from Yemen; Israeli forces deploy in Syrian buffer zone on Israeli border ■ SYRIA: Rebel coalition says will complete transfer of power to a transitional governing body with full executive powers ■ LEBANON: Israeli strikes on southern Lebanese villages kill six, health ministry says ■ GAZA: Mother of Gaza hostage says Israel 'going for a partial deal' that'll 'sentence to death' hostages left behind

Title: Biden: Fall of Assad regime 'direct result of Israeli blows' agai...
Description: ISRAEL: IDF intercepts missile from Yemen; Israeli forces deploy in Syrian buffer zone on Israeli border ■ SYRIA: Rebel coalition says will complete transfer of power to a transitional governing body with full executive powers ■ LEBANON: Israeli strikes on southern Lebanese villages kill six, health ministry says ■ GAZA: Mother of Gaza hostage says Israel 'going for a partial deal' that'll 'sentence to death' hostages left behind

Description: Recent events make it clear that the problem isn't how long the prime minister will have to devote to his testimony, but rather his use of power to disrupt the trial

Title: God, Syria and the Free Army': Ecstatic Syrian refugees in Hambu...

Title: A quick history of the Assads' Syrian rule, from dictatorship to ...

Title: The art world has become a dictatorship of the progressives'
Description: A year after her satirical video lampooned academia's support for Hamas and caused an uproar, New York-based Israeli artist and adjunct professor Tamy Ben-Tor is displaying new work in Israel. She tells Haaretz how Americans confuse culture and activism

Title: Israelis protest for hostage deal across country
Description: After Hamas released a hostage video of her son, Einav Zangauker called on Israelis to take to the streets. Anti-government organizations are leading the protest in central Tel Aviv's Azrieli Intersection for the first time since August, when they decided to let the hostages' families take the lead

Title: A time of war and extremes': New York's Other Israel Film Festiv...
Description: It might seem a thankless task right now to produce a festival showcasing both Israeli and Palestinian films. But the event's executive director says it's a chance to push back against extremism and boycotts: 'Film festivals are supposed to be places to open dialogue, but many have chosen avoidance over engagement'

Title: Romania's far-right 'TikTok Messiah': The dangerous rise of a fan...
Description: Calin Georgescu has come from nowhere to lead the field for Romania's presidential elections. A conspiracy theorist who calls the country's WWII fascist leaders 'heroes' is a danger for Romania and its Jewish community, and his phone call with an Israeli minister won't change that

Title: Israeli soldier killed by anti-tank missile in northern Gaza
Description: Master Sgt. Zamir Burke was killed in Jabalya, and another soldier was seriously wounded in the incident. Burke was described as 'a role model — a young man with a giant heart and an enormous sense of mission'

Title: Romania accuses Israel of election interference after Netanyahu m...
Description: Diaspora Affairs Minister Amichai Chikli's conversation with presidential candidate Calin Georgescu was publicized by far-right media in Romania and beyond. Georgescu has previously praised the antisemitic Iron Guard, known for its violent persecution of Jews

Title: Hamas delegation in Cairo to discuss 'day after' in Gaza, not hos...
Description: Hamas, along with Fatah and Islamic Jihad, is expected to discuss a shared governance mechanism for Gaza. Senior Palestinian officials say that even if hostages are discussed, chances of a breakthrough are low

Title: Israel at war, day 421: IDF says it struck in Lebanon due to ceas...
Description: IDF says it struck several times in Lebanon due to cease-fire agreement breaches, attacking Hezbollah targets. Medics in Gaza: Seven killed in IDF strike. Title: Palestinian-American historian Rashid Khalidi: 'Israel has create...

Title: A model of apartheid: Residents of this Palestinian village pay t...
Description: The inhabitants of Nu'man, in southeast Jerusalem, are residents of the territories and as such are not allowed to enter the capital. Other residents of the territories are banned from visiting the village, which pays municipal taxes but receives nothing in return – except demolished homes

Title: Sedatives by the crate': How Israelis can help their pets deal w...
Description: Air raid sirens, deafening fighter planes and explosions following the interception of missiles are making pets, and other animals, anxious – even to the point of needing psychiatric medication. Veterinarians recommend that owners project warmth and calm, or offer a treat, to help defuse fears
